artifacts.content:
{
  "market_analysis": {
    "tam": {
      "value": "$1.2 billion",
      "calculation": "Estimated total market for cloud-based developer tools and CI/CD platforms globally",
      "source_type": "industry_report"
    },
    "sam": {
      "value": "$350 million",
      "calculation": "Addressable market for enterprise-focused developer tooling in North America and Europe",
      "geographic_scope": "North America, Europe"
    },
    "som": {
      "value": "$42 million",
      "calculation": "Estimated 12% penetration of SAM in Year 3 based on competitive landscape and target user profile",
      "assumptions": [
        "Strong developer community adoption",
        "Seamless integration with popular CI/CD tools",
        "Effective enterprise sales strategy"
      ]
    },
    "growth_rate": "17% CAGR",
    "market_stage": "growing",
    "timing_assessment": "Optimal time to enter as enterprises increasingly adopt cloud-based developer tooling and CI/CD automation"
  },
  "competitors": [
    {
      "name": "GitLab",
      "type": "direct",
      "description": "Comprehensive DevOps platform with built-in CI/CD, code management, and project management",
      "strengths": [
        "Market leader",
        "Broad feature set",
        "Strong enterprise adoption"
      ],
      "weaknesses": [
        "Complex UI",
        "Limited customization",
        "Expensive for small teams"
      ],
      "pricing": "$19/user/month",
      "market_share_estimate": "35% of SAM",
      "key_differentiator": "End-to-end DevOps solution",
      "threat_level": "high"
    },
    {
      "name": "CircleCI",
      "type": "direct",
      "description": "Hosted continuous integration and continuous deployment platform",
      "strengths": [
        "Smooth CI/CD experience",
        "Extensive integrations",
        "Strong developer community"
      ],
      "weaknesses": [
        "Limited visibility and reporting",
        "Steep learning curve",
        "Pricing can be complex"
      ],
      "pricing": "$15/user/month",
      "market_share_estimate": "25% of SAM",
      "key_differentiator": "Specialized CI/CD focus",
      "threat_level": "high"
    },
    {
      "name": "Atlassian",
      "type": "indirect",
      "description": "Collaboration and project management suite including Jira and Bitbucket",
      "strengths": [
        "Brand recognition",
        "Enterprise adoption",
        "Broad product ecosystem"
      ],
      "weaknesses": [
        "Siloed tools",
        "Limited CI/CD capabilities",
        "Perceived complexity"
      ],
      "pricing": "$7/user/month",
      "market_share_estimate": "20% of SAM",
      "key_differentiator": "Integrated project management",
      "threat_level": "medium"
    }
  ],
  "trends": [
    {
      "trend": "Shift to cloud-based developer tools",
      "type": "technology",
      "impact": "Increased demand for hosted platforms that provide CI/CD, code management, and other DevOps capabilities",
      "timeline": "Current",
      "confidence": "high"
    },
    {
      "trend": "Emphasis on developer experience and productivity",
      "type": "consumer",
      "impact": "Enterprises seek tools that streamline workflows and improve developer efficiency",
      "timeline": "Current",
      "confidence": "high"
    },
    {
      "trend": "Increasing regulatory and compliance requirements",
      "type": "regulatory",
      "impact": "Need for tooling that can handle complex security and governance policies",
      "timeline": "1-2 years",
      "confidence": "medium"
    }
  ],
  "swot": {
    "strengths": [
      "Focused on developer experience and productivity",
      "Streamlined UI and workflows",
      "Tight integration with popular CI/CD tools"
    ],
    "weaknesses": [
      "Less feature-rich than comprehensive DevOps platforms",
      "Smaller brand recognition compared to market leaders",
      "Limited reporting and visibility capabilities"
    ],
    "opportunities": [
      "Underserved segment of small to medium-sized engineering teams",
      "Provide a simpler, more cost-effective alternative to enterprise-grade DevOps tools",
      "Leverage growing demand for cloud-based developer tooling"
    ],
    "threats": [
      "Potential for GitLab or Atlassian to expand their CI/CD capabilities",
      "Increasing regulatory and compliance requirements may favor more enterprise-focused solutions",
      "Difficulty in differentiating from existing market leaders"
    ]
  },
  "opportunities": [
    "Provide a streamlined, developer-centric CI/CD and build management platform that caters to the needs of small to medium-sized engineering teams",
    "Leverage the growing demand for cloud-based developer tooling and focus on improving developer productivity and efficiency"
  ],
  "risks": [
    {
      "risk": "Difficulty in differentiating from market leaders like GitLab and CircleCI",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "high",
      "mitigation": "Clearly define and communicate the unique value proposition, focus on user experience and developer-centric features"
    },
    {
      "risk": "Increasing regulatory and compliance requirements may favor more enterprise-focused solutions",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "medium",
      "mitigation": "Develop a roadmap to address evolving compliance needs, partner with security and governance experts"
    },
    {
      "risk": "Potential for market leaders to expand their CI/CD capabilities and encroach on the target segment",
      "probability": "high",
      "impact": "high",
      "mitigation": "Continuously innovate and stay ahead of the competition, focus on building a strong developer community and brand loyalty"
    }
  ],
  "recommendation": {
    "market_attractiveness": "8/10 - Growing market, clear opportunity to serve underserved segment, but competition is fierce",
    "entry_timing": "now",
    "key_success_factors": [
      "Streamlined developer experience",
      "Tight CI/CD integrations",
      "Effective enterprise sales strategy",
      "Continuous innovation to stay ahead of competition"
    ]
  }
}

{
  "mvp_definition": {
    "core_value_proposition": "A real-time dashboard for monitoring the status and progress of complex software builds",
    "target_user": "Technical leads and engineering managers responsible for overseeing software development projects",
    "key_differentiator": "Provides deep visibility into the build process, enabling better decision-making and faster issue resolution"
  },
  "mvp_features": [
    {
      "id": "build_list",
      "name": "Build List",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 90,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 9,
        "impact": 9,
        "confidence": 10,
        "effort": 7
      },
      "description": "Displays a list of active and completed builds with status indicators, timestamps, and duration",
      "user_story": "As a technical lead, I want to see a list of all ongoing and past builds so that I can track the progress and status of my team's work"
    },
    {
      "id": "phase_progression",
      "name": "Phase Progression",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 88,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 8,
        "impact": 9,
        "confidence": 9,
        "effort": 7
      },
      "description": "Provides a visual timeline of the build process, showing the status of each phase (discovery, design, architecture, frontend, backend, integration, testing, deployment)",
      "user_story": "As an engineering manager, I want to see the progress of each build phase so that I can identify bottlenecks and potential delays"
    },
    {
      "id": "agent_roster",
      "name": "Agent Roster",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 85,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 8,
        "impact": 8,
        "confidence": 9,
        "effort": 8
      },
      "description": "Lists all 35 agents involved in the build process, showing their current status and the task they're working on",
      "user_story": "As a technical lead, I want to see the status and progress of each agent in the build process so that I can identify any blockers or bottlenecks"
    },
    {
      "id": "constitutional_status",
      "name": "Constitutional Status",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 82,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 8,
        "impact": 8,
        "confidence": 8,
        "effort": 8
      },
      "description": "Displays a traffic light system (green/yellow/red) for up to 7 constitutional checks, along with a brief explanation of each status",
      "user_story": "As a technical lead, I want to see the status of the constitutional checks for the build so that I can ensure the build is compliant and identify any potential issues"
    },
    {
      "id": "understanding_panel",
      "name": "Understanding Your Build",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 80,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 7,
        "impact": 8,
        "confidence": 8,
        "effort": 8
      },
      "description": "Provides information about what was built, why it was built that way, and any known risks",
      "user_story": "As a technical lead, I want to understand the key decisions and reasoning behind the build so that I can better communicate the project to stakeholders and make informed decisions going forward"
    },
    {
      "id": "contextual_chat",
      "name": "Contextual Chat",
      "category": "supporting",
      "priority": "should_have",
      "rice_score": 70,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 7,
        "impact": 7,
        "confidence": 8,
        "effort": 8
      },
      "description": "Allows users to ask questions about the current build in a collapsible side panel",
      "user_story": "As a technical lead, I want to be able to ask questions and get clarification about the current build so that I can better understand and troubleshoot any issues"
    }
  ],
  "roadmap": {
    "phase_1_mvp": {
      "duration": "4-6 weeks",
      "features": [
        "build_list",
        "phase_progression",
        "agent_roster",
        "constitutional_status",
        "understanding_panel"
      ],
      "milestone": "Initial release of the Build Console dashboard"
    },
    "phase_2_enhance": {
      "duration": "4-6 weeks",
      "features": [
        "contextual_chat"
      ],
      "milestone": "Contextual chat and additional enhancements"
    },
    "phase_3_scale": {
      "duration": "ongoing",
      "features": [],
      "milestone": "Continuous improvements and feature additions based on user feedback"
    }
  },
  "technical_requirements": {
    "stack": {
      "frontend": "Next.js 14 + React 18 + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS",
      "backend": "Next.js API Routes",
      "database": "Supabase",
      "auth": "Supabase Auth"
    },
    "integrations": [
      "Supabase (for API endpoints and real-time updates)",
      "Lucide React (for icons)"
    ],
    "performance": {
      "initial_load": "<3s",
      "interaction_response": "<500ms",
      "lighthouse_target": ">90"
    },
    "security": [
      "HTTPS",
      "JWT tokens for authentication",
      "Input sanitization"
    ]
  },
  "success_criteria": {
    "launch_requirements": [
      "All critical features are functional",
      "No TypeScript errors",
      "Responsive design on desktop",
      "Core user flows are completable end-to-end"
    ],
    "validation_metrics": [
      "Users can access and understand the status of their builds in under 2 minutes",
      "Zero critical bugs in the core build monitoring workflow"
    ]
  },
  "featureChecklist": {
    "critical": [
      {
        "id": "build_list",
        "name": "Build List",
        "description": "Displays a list of active and completed builds with status indicators, timestamps, and duration",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays a table with columns for build name, status (queued, running, completed, failed), start time, end time, and duration",
          "Status indicators use color-coding: green for completed, yellow for running, red for failed",
          "Clicking on a build row navigates to the individual build detail page",
          "Builds are sorted with most recent at the top",
          "Pagination controls to browse through multiple pages of builds"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 1,
        "rice_score": 90
      },
      {
        "id": "phase_progression",
        "name": "Phase Progression",
        "description": "Provides a visual timeline of the build process, showing the status of each phase",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays a horizontal timeline with the following phases: discovery, design, architecture, frontend, backend, integration, testing, deployment",
          "Each phase shows its status (pending, active, completed, failed) using color-coding (green, yellow, red)",
          "Hovering over a phase displays a brief explanation of what that phase entails",
          "Phases are displayed in order, with the current active phase highlighted",
          "Completed phases show start and end timestamps"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 2,
        "rice_score": 88
      },
      {
        "id": "agent_roster",
        "name": "Agent Roster",
        "description": "Lists all 35 agents involved in the build process, showing their current status and the task they're working on",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays a list of all 35 agents organized by build phase",
          "Each agent card shows the agent's name, role description, current status (idle, working, completed, failed), and the task they're currently working on (if applicable)",
          "Agent cards are color-coded based on status (green for completed, yellow for working, red for failed)",
          "Clicking on an agent card navigates to a detailed view of that agent's progress and contributions"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 3,
        "rice_score": 85
      },
      {
        "id": "constitutional_status",
        "name": "Constitutional Status",
        "description": "Displays a traffic light system for up to 7 constitutional checks, along with a brief explanation of each status",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays up to 7 constitutional checks in a compact, grid-like layout",
          "Each check shows the article name, status (compliant, warning, violation), and a one-sentence explanation",
          "Status is indicated using a traffic light system: green for compliant, yellow for warning, red for violation",
          "Checks are sorted with the most severe issues (violations) at the top",
          "Clicking on a check navigates to a detailed view with more information"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 4,
        "rice_score": 82
      },
      {
        "id": "understanding_panel",
        "name": "Understanding Your Build",
        "description": "Provides information about what was built, why it was built that way, and any known risks",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays three sections: 'What was built', 'Why it was built this way', and 'Known risks'",
          "'What was built' lists the generated components and files",
          "'Why it was built this way' explains the key decisions and reasoning behind the build",
          "'Known risks' outlines any identified risks and the status of mitigation efforts",
          "Information is presented in a clear, concise manner using Tailwind typography classes"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 5,
        "rice_score": 80
      }
    ],
    "important": [
      {
        "id": "contextual_chat",
        "name": "Contextual Chat",
        "description": "Allows users to ask questions about the current build in a collapsible side panel",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays a collapsible side panel that is only visible when a specific build is selected",
          "The panel has a chat-like interface where users can enter questions and receive responses",
          "Questions are routed to the appropriate agents or the STRATEGOS role for answering",
          "Responses are displayed in the chat history with timestamps",
          "The panel can be collapsed when not in use to maximize screen real estate"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 6,
        "rice_score": 70
      }
    ],
    "niceToHave": []
  },
  "risks": [
    {
      "risk": "Integrating with the Supabase API for real-time updates and data fetching",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "high",
      "mitigation": "Thoroughly test the Supabase integration during development and have a fallback plan for handling API failures"
    },
    {
      "risk": "Displaying a large number of agents (35) in the roster panel",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "medium",
      "mitigation": "Implement pagination, infinite scrolling, or lazy loading to optimize the performance and user experience of the agent roster"
    },
    {
      "risk": "Ensuring the dashboard is responsive and usable on desktop-only",
      "probability": "low",
      "impact": "medium",
      "mitigation": "Focus the initial development effort on the desktop experience, and consider adding mobile optimization in a future phase based on user feedback"
    }
  ]
}

decisions.choice: {"pattern":"monolith","reasoning":"The OLYMPUS Builder Dashboard is a focused tool with manageable c
decisions.reasoning: The OLYMPUS Builder Dashboard is a focused tool with manageable complexity, suitable for a monolithic architecture that facilitates rapid development and iteration. As it currently targets a single interface and set of features, the monolith pattern allows for streamlined deployment and easier management.
